page.title: 02Local History, Ufton Village
page.content: The name appears to be of Saxon origin with many changes since the {ULCHTUNE} of the Domesday Book. After the Norman Conquest Ufton passed from the Benedictine Monastery at Coventry to Coventry Priory.It belonged to many others before becoming the property of Balliol College Oxford in 1679. In 1860 all but 90 acres belonged to Balliol.About 50 years ago the college began to sell off all parts of the Estate.The wood was sold to Mrs. Chamberlayne of Stoneythorpe then other parts to the Blue Circle Cement Company & so on. A church has stood on the site since 1042.The Village stocks were last used about 1840.The Village Hall was built in 1923.Electricity arrived in 1936, water 1950,gas 1969.
